Zend_Search_Lucene implementation to ind: Zend_Search_Lucene implementation to index all files and search a whole workspace quickly.
Parses the file when possible and index: Parses the file when possible and index its content (see plugin global options)
Which additionnal fields to index and se: Which additionnal fields to index and search
If your repository path is defined dynam: If your workspace path is defined dynamically by specific keywords like PYDIO_USER, or your own, mention them here.
Skip content parsing and indexation for: Skip content parsing and indexation for files bigger than this size (must be in Bytes)
List of extensions to consider as HTML f: List of extensions to consider as HTML file and parse content
List of extensions to consider as Text f: List of extensions to consider as Text file and parse content
Full path on the server to the 'unoconv': Full path on the server to the 'unoconv' binary
Full path on the server to the 'pdftotex: Full path on the server to the 'pdftotext' binary
Analyzer used by Zend to parse the queri: Analyzer used by Zend to parse the queries. Warning, the UTF8 analyzers require the php mbstring extension.
For the sake of performances, it is not: For the sake of performances, it is not recommanded to use wildcard as a very first character of a query string. Lucene recommends asking the user minimum 3 characters before wildcard. Still, you can set it to 0 if necessary for your usecases.
Automatically append a * after the user: Automatically append a * after the user query to make the search broader
Hide My Shares section in the Orbit them: Hide My Shares section in the Orbit theme GUI.
